basics.name: Jannel Bielza
basics.label: Shidler Undergraduate
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.B.A in Management Information Systems in the Shidler College of Business at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

Summary: Rebuilt a comprehensive resource database and revamped the website experience for the resource library, compiling credible sources on breast cancer topics to ensure accurate and reliable information. Led a redesign of the library section, enhancing site design, navigation, and accessibility, which significantly increased user engagement and satisfaction.

work.company: Hawaii Community College | Ko Education Center Dragon Den
Summary: Led a data-driven initiative in collaboration with the Ikuna Group, a nonprofit in Oakland, CA, to examine high school students' perceptions of culture, identity, and purpose through a student survey project. Administered surveys across multiple platforms, ensuring a diverse and representative sample to enhance data quality. Developed detailed questionnaires to assess program effectiveness, achieving a 15% improvement in curriculum alignment and a 20% increase in program retention. Synthesized survey data into comprehensive reports, delivering actionable insights to stakeholders that supported data-driven decision-making for program enhancements.

work.company: Hawaii community College | Ko Education Center
Summary: Led a strategic consultation with the CEO/President of Arc of Kona to analyze website performance metrics, identifying key areas to enhance user experience and engagement. Spearheaded a data-driven website overhaul using Squarespace, creating an intuitive interface that increased user engagement by 30%. Collaborated cross-functionally with designers, content creators, and developers to implement a modern, functional design aligned with organizational goals and user needs. Leveraged data insights and teamwork to ensure that website objectives reflected the organizationâ€™s mission, resulting in a cohesive online presence and clearer communication of key messages.
